results.title: Basic riding techniques
results.creator_credit: Film Australia, Timothy Read, Peter Johnson and Tony Hansen
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Motorcycle safety”.
Peter Wherrett and Jenny Johnson discuss why a learner should begin on a 250cc bike. Looks at instruments and controls and explains their application and proper usage. Recommends the best clothing and gear to wear for comfort and safety.

results.title: Basic reproduction processes in the graphic arts
results.brief_description: Explains briefly the four basic printing processes - letterpress, gravure, lithography and silk screen. The general principles are demonstrated as well as the means of preparing images for printing including the linotype and monotype machines, and mechanical and chemical photocopying equipment. Various types of printing presses are shown and reference is made to flexography for the printing of flexible packaging. No other credits available.

results.title: Basic parts and threading of the sewing machine
results.brief_description: Illustrates the construction and operation of a Singer 404 sewing machine. Demonstrates the filling of the bobbin and threading of the machine. Close up photography is used to show the position and use of the various parts. No other credits available.

results.title: Basic music industry skills
results.brief_description: Basic Music Industry Skills is an accredited Certificate Level Course suitable for use across the Years 9 to 12 curriculum. It is divided into modules focusing on different aspects of the music industry. Geared specifically to a teenage audience, it is nevertheless both informative and entertaining.

results.title: Basic movie making
results.brief_description: Explains the techniques for camera steadiness, zooming and panning, as well as ways in which to make movies visually interesting. Suitable for Upper Secondary-Tertiary level students. No other credits available.

results.title: Basic metalwork: soft soldering. Pt. 2
results.brief_description: An explanation of the fundamentals of soldering. Looks at joints relying on capillary action, preparation of ‘killed spirits’, the prevention of corrosion and the use of resin flux. No other credits available.

results.title: Basic metalwork: soft soldering. Pt. 1
results.brief_description: An explanation of the fundamentals of soldering. Fluxes and the principles of tinning and sweating; choice of bit; preparing the bit; joints relying on capillary action; preparation of “killed spirits” and the prevention of corrosion and use of resin in flux. No other credits available.
